Tanjim Abubokor

Working As Web DeveloperPython ProgrammerDjango Developer
about.description:
Hello there! My name is Tanjim Abubokor. I am a Web Devloper and Python Expart, and I'm very passionate and dedicated to my work.

I love to work on products that makes quite a significant positive impact on day to day lives of people. My focus is to create a product that will make you happy. I will give you a powerful backend with Django. I can help you take your business one step further. With my skills and experience, I can help you build a portfolio, business, e-commerce, sports, fitness, hospital management system, real-time chat web app, API integrations or API end-point, and custom websites. Thank you.

services.title: Chat Bot
services.short_description: With my expertise in Python programming and AI technologies, I will seamlessly integrate Chatbot into any platform(Website, telegram, others).
services.description:
If you are looking for a chatbot developer to make AI integrated chatbot or custom chatbot for your website, whatsapp, Telegram then you are at right place.

I can integrate chatGPT, Google BARD API with website, whatsapp or telegram to make AI chatbot that can give auto reply like a human.

I can also train GPT model according to your given data then chatbot can answer by taking information from your data that can help to build a AI integrated bot to act as a customer support for your company/business.

There are lots of field in which these chatbot can help you like:

-- Customer Support
-- Entertainment
-- Assistant
-- Health and Fitness
-- Restaurants

projects.title: E-ecommerce website
projects.description:
The project was Multi vendor E-commerce website. This is a open source projoect so you can use it for free.

Let's talk about functionality:
-- Multi-vendor
-- Blog post
-- Organized admin panel
-- Visitor Traking and More..

Get Started


To setup the project, here is the following guidelines:
-- Clone the repository git clone https://github.com/tanjim750/Django_agro_consultancy_farm.git
-- Open Project folder on terminal
-- Prepare your virtual environment python3 -m venv venv
-- Activate your virtual environment source env/bin/activate
-- Install your requirements.txt file pip install -r requirements.txt
-- Create migrations using python3 manage.py makemigrations
-- Run migrations python3 manage.py migrate
-- Start your dev server with python3 manage.py runserver
-- Visit your App using http://127.0.0.1:8000/
-- Create super user to access admin dashboard using python3 manage.py createsuperuser
-- Follow the prompts after Username: , Email address: , Password: , Password (again):
-- Visit Admin Page using http://127.0.0.1:8000/admin and login with the credentials created above.
-- Visit Products Page using http://127.0.0.1:8000/products/

blogs.title: Unleashing the Power of Django Cache: Boosting Performance and Efficiency
blogs.description:
In the fast-paced world of web development, optimizing performance is key to delivering a seamless user experience. One powerful tool in the Django framework that can significantly enhance your application's speed and efficiency is caching. In this blog post, we'll explore why caching is crucial, how it benefits us, and delve into practical steps on implementing it in your Django projects.

- Why Cache Matters:
Caching is like a supercharged memory that stores frequently accessed data, reducing the need to repeatedly fetch it from the original source. This not only accelerates response times but also minimizes server load, making your application more scalable.

- Benefits of Caching:
1. Faster Response Times: Caching allows your application to retrieve data quickly, enhancing user experience by reducing latency.

2. Reduced Server Load: By storing and serving cached content, your server handles fewer requests, freeing up resources for other tasks.

2. Improved Scalability: Caching contributes to better scalability, enabling your application to handle increased traffic without sacrificing performance.

- Using Django Cache:
Django provides a robust caching framework that is easy to implement. Here's a simple guide to get you started:

1. Configure Django Cache Settings:
In your Django project's settings.py, configure the cache backend. Adjust the settings based on your preferred cache backend (e.g., Memcached, Redis).

2. DecorateViewswith @cache_page:
Apply caching to specific views using the cache_page decorator.

3. Use Django's Low-Level Cache API:
For more control, leverage Django's low-level cache API.
